byline.contributor: Matthew Rosenberg contributed reporting from Fort Meade, Md.

abstract: Washington, DC, authorities report shooting of two men, one fatally, on grounds of National Security Agency at Fort Meade, Md; NSA security personnel say vehicle driven by two young men sped toward agency campus and ignored instructions from police to stop; officers fired on vehicle after driver, whose identity has not been disclosed, crashed into an NSA police car.
lead_paragraph: Officials said the car crashed into a police vehicle at the National Security Agency, which is protected by its own police force, in suburban Maryland.

headline.main: Driver Killed as Stolen Car Enters N.S.A. Campus
headline.print_headline: Driver Shot Dead as Car Enters N.S.A.’s Campus

snippet: Officials said the car crashed into a police vehicle at the National Security Agency, which is protected by its own police force, in suburban Maryland.
